intro: Eurya oreogena, commonly known as the alpine eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in China, Nepal, and Bhutan. This evergreen shrub typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or forested areas. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and dark green, while its small white or pink flowers bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species.
